text.0: by your high law firm order is established there where they loose for travel sūryas horses.
text.1: ten hundred stood together there i looked on this the most marvellous deities one chief glory.
text.2: this mitravaruṇa is your special greatness floods that stood there they with the days attracted.
text.3: ye cause to flow all voices of the cowpen your single chariotfelly hath rolled hither.
text.4: o mitravaruṇa ye by your greatness both kings have firmly stablished earth and heaven.
text.5: ye caused the cows to stream the plants to flourish and scattering swift drops sent down the rainflood.
text.6: let your wellharnessed horses bear you hither hitherward let them come with reins drawn tightly.
text.7: a covering cloud of sacred oil attends you and your streams flow to us from days aforetime.
text.8: to make the lustre wider and more famous guarding the sacred grass with veneration.
text.9: ye mitravaruṇa firm strong aweinspiring are seated on a throne amid oblations.
text.10: with hands that shed no blood guarding the pious whom varuni3 ye save amid oblations.
text.11: ye twain together kings of willing spirit uphold dominion based on thousand pillars.
text.12: adorned with gold its columns are of iron in heaven it glitters like a whip for horses.
text.13: or stablished on a field deepspoiled and fruitful so may we share the meath that loads your carseat.
text.14: ye mount your car goldhued at break of morning and ironpillared when the sun is setting.
text.15: and from that place o varuṇa and mitra behold infinity and limittion.
text.16: bountiful guardians of the world the shelter that is impenetrable strongest flawless.
text.17: aid us with that o varuṇa and mitra and when we long to win may we be victors.
